revised_title: Nitrogen Elimination in the Kidneys and Intestines during Rest and Exercise on a Non-Nitrogenous Diet
tldr: The author investigates the elimination of nitrogen by the kidneys and intestines during rest and exercise on a non-nitrogenous diet. The study compares the nitrogen excretion of two healthy soldiers and reveals a close relationship between body weight and urinary excretion. The results suggest that some nitrogen may be eliminated through the intestines, highlighting the importance of considering both renal and intestinal excretion in understanding nitrogen balance.
